column4: Using Flash Player X64 11 fromAdobes website. Ubuntu Oneiric X64 and ATI Video card, getting laggy flash player, and sound behind video :(
well does it say GLX with xdpyinfo? (xdpyinfo |grep -i glx)
It says GLX and SGI-GLX
that's good news..
And what about bad news ?
try this-> apt-get install mesa-utils.. then as normal user -> glxgears <enter>
see if that gear animation plays smoothly.. if it doesn't.. then there's something wrong..
Seems to play really smooth :)
that's godo
um.. it's probably something which i'm afraid to go into.. quite a few directions.. i'm betting it's the flash plugin
did u try google chrome ?
it's supposed to have flash builtin
Using Google Chrome, but it doesn't have a built in flash player anymore, so i downloades libflashplayer.so from adobe website, and put it into /opt/google/chrome/plugins/
did u try getting a 32-bit webbrowser working with 32bit flash?
What's point of getting 32bit software on Ubuntu X64 ?
well if that's your only way to get smooth flash.. just a thought..
as i said i'm afraid to get into directions.. it may even be your driver..
but your video driver shows everything normal..
is the audio croppy btw? (pulseaudio should be installed)
Don't know what means word "Croppy" but as I said video is a second or two lagging for the video :)
what did u use? apt-get install flashplugin-installer ?
No, as I Said i downloaded file from adobe website
try removing that file/move it someplace else-- then try that apt-get command i gave ya
Same problem :)
